Description: Black-topped red ware wide mouthed segmental bowl with a straight plain irregular rim and a rounded base; orangey-red fabric with clearly visible micaceous inclusions and organic voids, discoloured in places to an irregular patchy grey-black colour on the exterior, black and burnished on the interior surface and just over the exterior rim, a single register on the exterior surface below the rim band of a slightly irregular incised pendant triangular motif with vertical incisions. Handmade. Complete with a slight crack on one side.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Northern Dongola Reach, Site P37 Grave (G3) Context 41d
Type series: NDRS type B13.5 (published form type series number)
NDRS type D41.10 (published decoration type series number)
Bibliographic references: Welsby Sjöström 2001a / The Pottery from the Survey (p.301, fig. 5.32)
Welsby Sjöström 2001b / Pottery from the Kerma Moyen graves at Site P37 (page 351, fig. 6.4)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sudan Archaeological Research Society
Division of Finds: National Corporation for Antiquities and Museums (NCAM)
Acquisition notes: Division of finds from the National Corporation for Antiquities and Museums, Khartoum to SARS, the license holder.
Additional IDs: Excavation/small finds number: 927x (excavation type series number)
Excavation/small finds number: 942e (excavation type series number)
Excavation/small finds number: 958e (excavation type series number)
